text: The Philippines participated at the 2015 Summer Universiade in Gwangju, South Korea. For the first time in three appearances at the Universiade, the Philippines did not send a delegation for basketball. The Philippine Olympic Committee was criticized by PSL President Susan Papa for prohibiting players from its member national sports associations from participating at the tournament. ==Competitors== {| class="wikitable sortable" style="font- size:95%; text-align:center;" ! width=120|Sport ! width=55|Men ! width=55|Women ! width=55|Total |- | align=left|Badminton | 3 || 3 || 6 |- | align=left|Judo | 1 || 0 || 1 |- | align=left|Swimming | 25 || 19 || 44 |- | align=left|Table tennis | 3 || 3 || 6 |- | align=left|Tennis | 3 || 3 || 6 |-class="sortbottom" !
